tn.ref: this is the declaration of Yahweh of hosts
tn.text: This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.

tn.ref: cut off the names of the idols from the land
tn.text: AT: "erase idol worship throughout the land"

tn.ref: I will also cause the false prophets and their unclean spirit to go out of the land
tn.text: AT: "I will also remove the false prophets and their impure spirits from the land."

tn.ref: his father and mother who bore him
tn.text: The phrase "who bore him" describes "his father and mother" in order to express surprise that someone's own parents would treat him in this way.
AT: "You must die"
Stab him to kill him." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to the false prophets, not to the true prophets of Yahweh.

tn.ref: no longer wear a hairy cloak
tn.text: "Cloak" refers to a heavy outer garment. s made of animal hair that prophets usually wore.
That is, "farms."

tn.ref: the land became my work while I was still a young man
tn.text: Some modern versions translate this Hebrew text as "a man acquired me in my youth," that is, acquired him as a servant.

tn.ref: What are these wounds between your arms?
tn.text: AT: "How did you get those cuts on your chest?" This refers to the apparent custom of false prophets wounding themselves in their ceremonies.
That is, he will answer with a lie.

AT: "You, sword! You must wake up." This is a command from Yahweh for his shepherd to be attacked and killed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_apostrophe]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
This refer to a certain king or a certain servant of Yahweh.

tn.ref: this is the declaration of Yahweh of hosts
tn.text: This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.
"The flock" refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This probably refers to all the Israelites who are weak and defenseless.
This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.

tn.ref: I will bring that third through the fire
tn.text: Metal is passed through fire in order to purify or harden it. This expression serves here as a metaphor for exposing the people to suffering in order that they may become more faithful to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: refine them as silver is refined; I will test them as gold is tested
tn.text: Refining refers to making precious metals such as silver more pure. Metals such as silver and gold are tested in order to discover how pure or strong they are. Both refining and testing are here metaphors for making the people more faithful to God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
